text: Is there a Julia Stack Exchange? if not? why not? I use LaTeX a lot, and I love that within a quick search, I can find every answer to every question about LaTeX on the stack exchange. While this is a good place to congregate, I thought that a common place for Q's and A's to be addressed would be nice. Plus slack comments older than 10,000 recent posts requires a premium account, making it impossible for me to search if someone had the same question one month ago.

elements.text: Is there a Julia Stack Exchange? if not? why not? I use LaTeX a lot, and I love that within a quick search, I can find every answer to every question about LaTeX on the stack exchange. Plus slack comments older than 10,000 recent posts requires a premium account, making it impossible for me to search if someone had the same question one month ago.

text: there is the julia tag on stackoverflow <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/julia>, isn't that enough?  also, starting a new separate stackexchange project is a hassle, especially when <https://discourse.julialang.org/> works pretty well already

text: Yes, you are correct, one is enough. I just didn't know about the stack overflow. (doh)
